paragraphs.content: Chapter 4
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 4

paragraphs.content: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.

paragraphs.content: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,

paragraphs.content: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:

paragraphs.content: And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

paragraphs.content: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:

paragraphs.content: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

paragraphs.content: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

paragraphs.content: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

paragraphs.content: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:

paragraphs.content: That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?

paragraphs.content: ¶ The sower soweth the word.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ The sower soweth the word.

paragraphs.content: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.

paragraphs.content: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;

paragraphs.content: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word’s sake, immediately they are offended.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word’s sake, immediately they are offended.

paragraphs.content: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,

paragraphs.content: And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

paragraphs.content: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?

paragraphs.content: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.

paragraphs.content: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.

paragraphs.content: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;

paragraphs.content: And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.

paragraphs.content: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.

paragraphs.content: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?

paragraphs.content: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:

paragraphs.content: But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.

paragraphs.content: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.

paragraphs.content: But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.

paragraphs.content: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.

paragraphs.content: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.

paragraphs.content: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.

paragraphs.content: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?

paragraphs.content: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?

paragraphs.content: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
